title: incorrect versions being offered via thunderbird-latest and thunderbird_versions.json
content:
The latest Thunderbird isn't being properly offered. Both

https://product-details.mozilla.org/1.0/thunderbird_versions.json

and

https://download.mozilla.org/?product=thunderbird-latest&os=linux64&lang=en-US

currently indicate 115.14.0 while the main Thunderbird site is offering 128.1.0esr
creator: tmoo36

title: Thunderbird displays OAuth popup for deleted Gmail account
content:
I had a gmail account, I no longer have the gmail account. I deleted the IMAP and SMTP entries. I have no CardDAV entry for that account, no calendar entry, and no chat entry (that I can see; but that old account is lurking somewhere). None of my extensions use (user-configurable) credentials.

What else is there? Is there a way that I can search Thunderbird's config for the account username?

I'm about to screenshot settings, archive this profile, and start anew. I'd really like to avoid that, because I have collected >10 email accounts over the decades and setting everything back up all at once seems a hassle.

What are next troubleshooting steps? TIA for any wisdom or guidance.
creator: retardude

title: Pasted, Custom msgfilterrules.dat file causes ERROR
content:
The message in image pops up, TB saves file as BAK, creates new empty .dat

As I did a while back, I am creating a "MASTER FILTER" file for use by ALL of my many email accounts. Assembled them into one .txt file in MSWord, then save, renamed as .dat and copie into profile in place of the existing. Closed TB before pasting, then re-opened and got the error.

I suspect there is some type of error or corruption in my custom file, but have no way to test it or otherwise find out.

Will gladly email my file to anyone that thinks they can check it.
creator: mminieri

Thank you.
creator: nataliaroberts85

title: Cannot delete IMAP Folder
content:
I've read many threads on this, none of which seems to work. Most grateful for assistance to finally get rid of these phantom folders.

Problem: Multiple folders in an IMAP account that simply will not delete.

Symptom: Folder exists in an IMAP account that has all folders as sub-folders under Inbox. Some folders are empty and appear greyed out and italicized. Deleting them sends them to the Deleted folder (or if the appropriate setting is changed, to be immediately deleted). Emptying the Deleted folder appears to get rid of the deleted folders, but restart and they reappear.

Attempted Fixes: As suggested in various places, have tried these things, none of which work:

  • Immediate delete (setting and also simply deleting in the Deleted folder)
  • Creating a new folder of a different name and renaming it to the affected folder, then deleting -- would not rename new folder, and phantom folder remained
  • Completely removing the account (settings and data) and recreating

Other Actions: I have checked the actual IMAP account via a webmail interface and none of the folders exist in the account.

creator: kwhoopes

title: Difficulty when starting Thunderbird
content:
For the past couple of months, every time I boot up my computer and launch Thunderbird I get the attached error messages for each of my email accounts (2 Hotmail and one Outlook)

Repeatedly clicking "retry" often results in success but sometimes I get the second message indicating the server has disconnected. Usually, after a few minutes things settle down, the messages come through and all is well but it is a nuisance. I would switch to using Outlook but it cannot send multiple emails which I periodically need to do and I don't want to encourage Microsoft's near monopoly of computer technology.

I have tried accepting coookies as advised elsewhere in here and tried turning on O Oath as my authentication method but this just got me another error message saying this authentication "was not supported on this platform" (whatever that means??) Anyway, I reverted to using "simple password" which does eventually work.

I looked at 2 factor authentication but that proved to be impossible to understand and, in any case, I rarely carry a 'phone with me and do not want to clutter my 'phone up with more apps. I use 2 factor authentication on a lot of my confidential accounts and none of these were as complicated to set up as this one and certainly did not invole scanning QR codes and installing special apps.

Will this bug be fixed by more updates to Thunderbird or is there some other way of solving this problem.
creator: colrose.b
